definition: (idiom) "no comment"
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: I believe i said no comment.
Putin’s chief spokesman yesterday said he had ‘no comment’ on the reports.
sentences.chinese: 普京的主要发言人昨天表示对上述报道“无可奉告”。

sentences.english: I have nothing to say about the incident.

sentences.chinese: 梁洛施发言人表示无可奉告。

sentences.english: He said, “No-comment” when the reporters asked him if the killer was arrested.
sentences.chinese: 当记者们打探是否捉到了凶手时，他说“无可奉告”。

definition: (idiom) reluctant to speak about it/tight-lipped
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
(honorific) to inform
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
lit. mysteries of heaven must not be revealed (idiom); must not be revealed/I am not at liberty to inform you.
pinyin: tian1 ji1 bu4 ke3 xie4 lu4

definition: to equivocate/to talk evasively (idiom)
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
to refuse to comment/same as 不置可否
to do things in a strictly businesslike manner (idiom)
to be sorry/to feel apologetic/sorry!
comment/statement
secret/classified (information)
